questions.text: True or False: IAM roles are specific to each AWS region.
You are provisioning an EC2 instance that needs access to an S3 bucket. Which of the following is the best way to do this?
answers: Add your Access Key ID and Secret Access ID to the EC2
Create a IAM Group with S3 access and add the EC2 instance to that group
Add a IAM Role to the EC2 that has access to the S3 bucket
correctAnswers: Add a IAM Role to the EC2 that has access to the S3 bucket

questions.text: You are provisioning an EC2 instance that needs access to an S3 bucket. Which of the following is the best way to do this?
answers: Add your Access Key ID and Secret Access ID to the EC2
Create a IAM Group with S3 access and add the EC2 instance to that group
Add a IAM Role to the EC2 that has access to the S3 bucket
correctAnswers: Add a IAM Role to the EC2 that has access to the S3 bucket

questions.text: You are provisioning a virtual machine outside of AWS that needs access to an S3 bucket. Which of the following is the best way to do this?
answers: Add your personal admin Access Key ID and Secret Access ID to the VM.
Create an IAM User with access to the bucket. Add the keys of this user to the VM.
Create a IAM Group with S3 access and add the VM instance to that group.
Add a IAM Role to the VM that has access to the S3 bucket.
correctAnswers: Create an IAM User with access to the bucket. Add the keys of this user to the VM.

questions.text: True or False. You can use Active Directory federation in conjunction with IAM
It is a good idea to limit the amount of IAM Groups you create to prevent high costs
Which AWS service enables you to request temporary, limited-privilege credentials for IAM users or federated users?
When you authenticate to AWS via Google or Facebook along with STS what action is called that provides a user with temporary security credentials?
Which of the following should you utilize when you have several users that should have the same permissions?
When a new user is created in an existing account, by default the user has permission to create up to 5 S3 buckets and spin up up to 5 EC2 instances
True of False. You can attach multiple roles to an EC2 instance
True of False. AWS automatically tracks versions of your policies so that you can easily rollback policy changes
You are provisioning an EC2 instance that needs access to an S3 bucket. Which of the following is the best way to do this?
answers: Add your Access Key ID and Secret Access ID to the EC2
Create a IAM Group with S3 access and add the EC2 instance to that group
Add a IAM Role to the EC2 that has access to the S3 bucket
correctAnswers: Add a IAM Role to the EC2 that has access to the S3 bucket

questions.text: True of False. You can retrieve your Secret Access Key by contacting AWS support should you lose it.
True of False. A user can belong to multiple Groups.
Can you add an IAM role to an EC2 instance that is already running?
answers: You cannot add IAM roles to EC2 instances at any time

questions.text: Can federated users access the console or AWS APIs?
answers: Federated Users can access the console only
Federated Users can access APIs only
Federated Users can access either the console or AWS API's
correctAnswers: Federated Users can access either the console or AWS API's

questions.text: After authenticating against your ADFS server and receiving a SAML assertion what API call is made to request temporary security credentials?
